meanings.sent1: The teacher was issuing textbooks to the students.
meanings.sent2: The post office is issuing stamps for the new collection.
meanings.sent3: The bakery was issuing delicious pastries to the hungry customers.
meanings.sent4: The factory was issuing smoke into the air, causing pollution.
meanings.sent5: The queen was issuing orders to her loyal subjects.

meanings.sent1: The sun was issuing from behind the clouds, brightening the sky.
meanings.sent2: The flowers were issuing from the ground after the spring rain.
meanings.sent3: The laughter was issuing from the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: The music was issuing from the speakers, filling the room with melody.
meanings.sent5: The excitement was issuing from the crowd as the parade passed by.

meanings.definition: To make something available for use or sale
meanings.sent1: The store was issuing discounts on all items for the holiday sale.
meanings.sent2: The company was issuing new software updates for the customers.
meanings.sent3: The library was issuing library cards to the eager readers.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant was issuing a new menu with delicious dishes.
meanings.sent5: The website was issuing free downloads of the latest songs.
